intro: Tricyrtis formosana var. formosana, commonly known as the Formosan spiderwort, is a species native to Taiwan. It is a herbaceous perennial that belongs to the ginger family, Zingiberaceae. The plant features striking, spatulate-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, fragrant, violet-blue flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, making it suitable for woodland gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its unique foliage and delicate blooms.
